isis.stitle: CALIPER DISC BRAKES - SERVICE PROCEDURES - CLEANING AND INSPECTION OF CALIPERS AND PADS

svcproc.title: CLEANING AND INSPECTION OF CALIPERS AND PADS

step1.para:
Visually inspect the caliper housing for leakage. If leakage is evident, overhaul the caliper as described in , DISASSEMBLE
and REASSEMBLE CALIPER
.

Use a wire brush to remove any rust or corrosion from machined surfaces of the caliper and anchor plate. It is important to clean those areas of the caliper and anchor plate that are in contact during the sliding action of the caliper.
Measure the lining thickness. If the minimum thickness is less than 3/16 inch (4.76mm), new pad assemblies should be installed on both wheels/brakes of that axle ( Figure 17).
Figure 18 shows pads which require replacement if lining material shows excessive cracking at the edges and poor contact surface.

figure.caption: Figure 18. Example Of An Unserviceable Brake Pad

note.para: Brake pads are to be replaced by axle. Never replace brake pads at only one wheel/brake end.

step1.para: Brake pads with excessive chipping or flaking must be replaced. If an examination of the pads reveals 20% or more has no contact area with the rotor, the pads must be replaced. Figure 19 illustrates three progressive conditions of pad to rotor contact. The polished contact area is represented in the illustration by the white area on the pad surface.

figure.caption: Figure 19. Example of Brake Pad Service Conditions

step1.para: The top view in ( Figure 19) illustrates a new or like new pad that has full contact with the rotor while the center view shows a pad that has 70% contact with the rotor. The center pad is still serviceable. The bottom pad shows 80% or more has no contact with the rotor and must be replaced.
Brake pads contaminated by grease, oil or other materials which cannot be easily cleaned by using denatured alcohol and dried by compressed air must be replaced.
Examine the pads for flatness of the contact surface. Any pad found with a concave or convex bend more than 1/64 inch (0.381mm) should be replaced ( Figure 20).

figure.caption: Figure 20. Acceptable Limits to Brake Pad Warping

step1.para: Inspect rotors. Rotors with severe cracks or burn spots (Hot Spots) must be replaced.

svcproc.para: Complete details pertaining to reconditioning rotors can be found in GROUP 04 - BRAKES HYDRAULIC in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
